Package com.github.actionfx.core.bind

Class ObservableListBinding<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.bind.AbstractBinding<java.util.List<E>,​javafx.collections.ObservableList<E>>
      • com.github.actionfx.core.bind.ObservableListBinding<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the element type of the source and target list
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Binding
    public class ObservableListBinding<E>
extends AbstractBinding<java.util.List<E>,​javafx.collections.ObservableList<E>>
    Binding implementation that binds a target ObservableList to a source List. In case the source list provided is also an ObservableList, the binding will be bidirectional. In case the source list is not observable, a unidirectional binding is applied.

    This binding also supports a SelectionModel, that can be optionally used to add / remove elements to/from the target list. This is handy for binding e.g. multi-selection lists from controls like a ListView that can not be bound directly bidirectionally , as these are read-only observable lists.

    Author:
    koster

      • ObservableListBinding

        public ObservableListBinding​(java.util.List<E> source,
                             javafx.collections.ObservableList<E> target,
                             javafx.scene.control.SelectionModel<E> selectionModel)
        Constructor accepting the binding source and binding target, where the source can be of type List and the binding target must be of type ObservableList.

        As third argument, a SelectionModel can be provided. This argument is nullable. However, if provided, manipulation of the binding target list is only performed through the supplied SelectionModel, as it might be the case that the supplied binding target list does not allow the user to add elements (this is the case e.g. for the selected items observable list in a ListView).

        Parameters:
        source - the binding source
        target - the binding target
        selectionModel - an optional selection model for manipulating entries in the binding target
